# Land Development Services

__

#### Land Development Services Alert:

CONTACT INFORMATION:  Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. and Friday, 9:15 a.m. - 4 p.m. Please note that visitors may not be added to in-person queues past 3:45 p.m. 

__

703-222-0801 TTY 711

__

LandDevelopmentServices@fairfaxcounty.gov

__

12055 Government Center Pkwy  
Fairfax, VA 22035

fairfaxcounty

Bill Hicks  
Director

# Permit Library: Residential Building

## ON THIS PAGE

  * Household Appliance
  * New Building
  * Addition/Alteration
  * Miscellaneous
  * Retaining Wall



  * Demolition
  * Electrical
  * Mechanical
  * Plumbing
  * Solar



## Household Appliance

A Household Appliance permit is required for the replacement and first-time installation of appliances, including fuel-fired appliances, within a residence that requires one final inspection only.

Learn More

## New Building

A residential New Building permit is required for the following types of projects:

  * New Single-Family Dwelling (New Custom Home or approved Masterfile)
  * New Single-Family Dwelling on Existing Foundation (based on definition of an addition in Chapter 61 of the Fairfax County Code)
  * New Townhouse
  * New Detached Structure 
    * Pool/Bath house, Detached Garage, Detached Carport, Accessory Structure/Building, Gazebo, Pole Barn, Shed (if over 256 square feet)



Learn More

## Addition/Alteration

Residential additions and alterations include renovations, decks, finished basements and more.

Learn More

## Miscellaneous

A Residential Miscellaneous permit is required for the following residential projects:

  * Areaways
  * Asbestos Abatement
  * Chimney Reline
  * Chimney Repair
  * Foundation Repair
  * Interior Drain Tile
  * Interior/Exterior Waterproofing



  * Mobile Home
  * New Masonry Chimney
  * Pools
  * Spas
  * Re-Roof/Re-Line
  * Roof Repair
  * Other miscellaneous



Learn More

## Retaining Wall

A residential Retaining Wall permit is required for construction of residential retaining walls retaining more than three feet of earth but less than four feet of earth, non-tiered, non-stacked and non-segmental with level backfill and no surcharge loading.

Learn More

## Demolition

A Residential Demolition permit is required for the complete demolition of a residential structure, partial demolition of a residential structure, or demolition of a residential pool.

Learn More

## Electrical

A residential electrical permit is required for new residential service, new electrical equipment and/or fixtures, replacement of electrical equipment or fixtures, and electrical vehicle charging station circuits and outlets.

Learn More

## Mechanical

A mechanical building permit is required for the following projects:

  * New, Replacement, Repair or Conversion of HVAC Systems
  * New Installations of Miscellaneous Mechanical Equipment: fireplaces, logs, flue, range hoods, stove/range, tanks, etc.
  * Installation of Pool/Hot Tub Heaters
  * Geothermal System Installation
  * Duct Installation (new or replacement)
  * Gas Piping for Equipment



Learn More

## Plumbing

A Residential Plumbing permit is required for any of the following projects:

  * New sewer or water connections
  * Disconnection of sewer or water connections 
  * Installing new plumbing equipment/fixtures
  * Replacing or repairing plumbing equipment/fixtures



Learn More

## Solar

A residential solar permit is required for roof-mounted and free-standing residential solar projects.

Learn More

  


Back to Top

  
Need Help? Call **703-222-0801** , **TTY 711**.

Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Friday from 9:15 a.m. to 4 p.m.

  * LDS Permit Library: Access guides to navigate every record type in PLUS.
  * Letters to Industry: Subscribe for LDS announcements, notices, and tech bulletins.
  * Meet With Staff: Find a staff member to help you with the permit process.

metadata.description: Fairfax County, Virginia - LDS building and site records are applied for in PLUS. Below you will find a list of LDS record types available in PLUS along with the associated process requirements for that record.
metadata.keywords: household appliance, addition, alteration, renovation, demo, demolition, electrical, mechanical, miscellaneous, new building, plumbing, MEPs, retaining wall, solar, LDS, land development, PLUS
